SaturnFirst: ^Well, hello there, gorgeous! Name's Saturn. Yours?
^Mmm... nah. Way too generic. That's like if I was named "Planet."
^I'm gonna call you "Luna." How's that sound?
^You don't get to pick my name.

c-0: ^ Ummm... that actually... that's pretty good...
^I should hope so. A beautiful face like yours should have a beautiful name to go with it.
c-1: ^Ah don't worry, you'll get used to it.
c-2: ^ You... uh, you don't get... uh...
^Awestruck, right? Yeah darling, I've seen it before. Happens all the time.
g-0: ^Now, what brings you down to Saturn Town?
^I'm looking for another planet to orbit.

c-3: ^ I'm... looking for... something to orbit....
c-4: ^ I... I want to be... your moon?
^Ah, you flatter me, darling! You and everyone else, though!
^You suddenly notice that Saturn is surrounded by moons.
^Awesome, right? And it's no wonder why. After all, check THESE out!
c-5: ^Well, you've found the right place to look around! Check THESE out!

another_planet: ^Orbit? Darling, I'm the KING of orbits! Check out all the moons I've got orbiting right now!
^You suddenly notice that Saturn is surrounded by moons.
^Awesome, right? No small feat that is, either. So, you need some advice?

c-1: ^ More like I... uh... I need...
^Oh darling, whatever it is that you need, you need my advice more.
g-0: ^Alright, Rule Number 1 is Confidence. You gotta be able to sell yourself, and you're not gonna do that without sounding confident.
^Rule Number 2 is Uniqueness. You gotta make yourself stand out from the pack. Figure out something that makes you unique and sell it. For example, check THESE out!

main: ^Saturn makes a point of showing off their rings, tilting them so Sun's light reflects off them and blinds you.

c-1: ^You notice that Saturn's moons, previously uninterested, are now staring at you. Saturn looks appalled.
^WHAT?? H-how could you say that? The most magnificent rings in the solar system, and they're NOT THAT COOL?
^... whatever. I'll just... pretend you didn't say that, OK? OK.
g-0: ^Anyway, if you're looking to become one of my moons (and you TOTALLy are-- it's sooo obvious)
^... then you'll need to take my quiz.
^It's not personal, darling. I just need a vetting process on account of how many moons want to be mine.
^Let me just grab my slide deck and... hmm. Rhea, where's my slide deck?
^How should I know? I never touched that damn thing.
^Hmm. Well, come back later and I'll get you quizzed up in no time flat, darling.

SaturnSecond: ^Ah, excellent timing, darling! I found my slide deck, so we can continue with the quiz. Gather round, everyone!
^The moons crowd around you while Saturn pulls out a stack of index cards with "Rizz Quiz" printed on the back.
^OK! Question 1 - How many planets orbit between Saturn and the sun? Not including myself, of course.

c-0: ^Oh, that's not right! The correct answer was 5! But don't worry, you're not eliminated yet.
c-1: ^5 is correct! Though, let's be real here, that was an easy one.
c-2: ^Oh, that's not right! The correct answer was 5! But don't worry, you're not eliminated yet.
c-3: ^Oh, that's not right! The correct answer was 5! But don't worry, you're not eliminated yet.
g-0: ^Question 2 - I'm qualified by some as a gas giant. What other planet would fit this description?

c-4: ^That is not correct! You'll find only planets that are neither gaseous nor giant on the other side of the Asteroid Belt.
c-5: ^That is not correct! You'll find only planets that are neither gaseous nor giant on the other side of the Asteroid Belt.
c-6: ^That is not correct! You'll find only planets that are neither gaseous nor giant on the other side of the Asteroid Belt.
c-7: ^You are absolutely correct! My homie Jupiter is also a gas giant-- even moreso than I!

g-1: ^Question 3 - True or False: There might be life on one of my moons!

c-8: ^ I... I'm sorry. I don't know.
^That's alright! I'll just count it as wrong, and move on. Question 4 -
^It's alright, Luna! Everyone gets that question wrong.
^Hmm, that's a good point. Maybe I should write a better question.  Anyway--
^Actually, why would anyone need to know that?
^Why would anyone need to know any of this?
c-9: ^ Wha-- why does this matter? Why do I have to know every little thing about you before I can orbit you?
^Please, darling, it's all part of the process. Now, to repeat the question--
c-10: ^Ah, you've met Earth? How are they doing? It's been a while since I've crossed the Belt.
^Earth's moon? What are you doing all the way out here?
^I... we broke up... I ran away...
^Oh my! Well, isn't that an interesting twist!
^You JERK! You didn't even ask where they were from?

matter: ^Wait a minute, they're right! This quiz IS stupid!
^Yeah! If anything, you should be asking questions about THEM!
^Now now, I just like to know how much my moons have learned about me!
^I didn't even get any of the questions right!
^Tell me ONE thing that YOU'VE learned about Luna!
main: ^Well, I... uh... you know... uh... one thing I should...

c-0: ^ How could you be so self-centered that you don't even care to get to know your moons? How is anyone supposed to love you if you can't love them?
c-1: ^Saturn, I know you're very proud of yourself, but could you at least make an EFFORT to focus on something that isn't yourself?
g-0: ^... y'know what. Quiz is cancelled. I'm gonna go reflect on this.
^Saturn storms off. leaving you with all of their moons.
^I-I'm sorry... I shouldn't have said anything...
^Hey, it's alright. Saturn needed to hear that.
^Trust me, they're nice... but sometimes they only see themselves.
^How about you take a breather? We'll go talk to Saturn.
